html:
Snap a Sunset at Washington Harbour and Win a Trip

Nick's Riverside Grill and Tony and Joe's Seafood Place present "Sunsets by the Water," a photo contest beginning March 1.

Dr. Tina Alster to Address American Academy of Dermatology in Miami

This week, Dr. Tina Alster will be lecturing on the latest skin treatments at the 71st Annual Meeting of the American Academy of Dermatology in Miami. Directing the Fractional Laser and Light-Based Technologies course on Friday, March 1st, Dr.

The 'Heart Ball' Raises Record Funds

The generous and enthusiastic crowd at this year's American Heart Association "Heart Ball" gave $1,350,000 in gifts overall, with the best live and silent auction in its history ($188,000 raised).

A New IPod Touch Is The Prize

Now and through Friday March 15, to celebrate its first anniversary, Beasley Real Estate is running a contest for all new and current mobile app clients. The prize: a new iPod Touch.

Construction Zone Pulled From Park Entrance

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

Ashley Judd at GWU March 1

Actress and political activist Ashley Judd will appear at The George Washington School of Public Health and Health Services this Friday, March 1 from 3:00-4:30 pm to discuss "Progress and Perspectives: Women's Reproductive Health."

Fiola Mare to Open at Washington Harbour

Fiola Mare, an Italian seafood restaurant owned by restaurateur Fabio Trabocchi, has signed a 15-year lease with MRP Realty for 9,000 square feet at Washington Harbour.

#Winning!

Washingtonians got their wish when Argo won best picture. Washingtonians like to win, it’s kind of a city trademark.

Sea Catch Hosts First Annual Mussels and Beer Tasting March 15

Mark your calendars: March 15th from 6:00 to 9:00 pm, Sea Catch will be hosting their first annual mussels and beer tasting party!

Bonhams' Martin Gammon Discovers Important Abraham Lincoln Letter on Antiques Roadshow

Bonhams' Martin Gammon discovers important Abraham Lincoln letter on Monday's Antiques Roadshow.

Range Opens to Rave Reviews

Chef Bryan Voltaggio's Range Restaurant, one of the most highly anticipated restaurant openings in Washington for years, has exceeded expections for food, service and atmosphere.

Jack Evans Looks Back but Keeps Moving Forward

Ward 2 Councilmember Jack Evans recently became the longest serving member of the City Council.

L'Eclaireur Number 26

It's been a tough week for my olfactory glands. On a quest for a more complex and layered version of my current signature fragrance, Chloe, I annoyed way too many salespeople (and customers) by asking them to smell my wrists and elbows.

'The List'

I recognized Elsa on page 11 of The List, the author’s thinly disguised real best friend in her breakout first novel.

Washington Fine Properties Sells Historic Laird-Dunlop Coach House

Washington Fine Properties (WFP) announced Wednesday the sale of the Laird-Dunlop Coach House, one of the most iconic homes in D.C. and located in Georgetown’s East Village.

Wine and Serving Temperature

Wine is a game of pleasure, taste, smell, texture – an experience in each bottle.

Hotel Monticello to Become The Graham Georgetown

"When one door closes, another opens; but we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us."

Alexander Graham Bell

George Town Club Leaders Recruit Young Professionals

By Alix PianinCurrent Staff Writer

A young professionals committee is working to breathe new life into the nearly 50-year-old George Town Club, where facility use has been on the decline in recent years, members say.

The Heart Ball Saturday Night!

I look forward to the Heart Ball each year; and this Saturday night's is no exception. A premier society event, expect an elegant black-tie at one of the most beautiful spaces in town: The National Building Museum.

Sugar Isn't As Sweet As We Think

I know sugar is bad for me. I know it is bad for my waistline, and most likely for other reasons also. I am sure you know that too. Yet sometimes I need a reminder, and you may too. So here are the many reasons sugar is bad for us.

Watch for the Art of Restoration at Tudor Place Feb. 21

Meet master restorerers George Thomas and Hartwig Balke on February 21 at Tudor Place. They'll explain how watches were made in the 18th century and discuss how to recognize poorly made repairs.

Last year saw the arrival of Dutch-based Suitsupply for men, Spanish designer Massimo Dutti and

82nd Annual Georgetown House Tour April 27th

Stephanie Bothwell, principal of Urban and Landscape Design, along with renowned Washington interior decorator Frank Babb Randolph, will once again lead the historic Georgetown House tour which this year will feature nine spectacular homes showcasing the best of Georgetown.
Georgetown Art Show Draws Crowd to House of Sweden

Theodore Roosevelt Island

Celebrate President's Day with a walk on the wild side. Visit the only island commemorating a president and one you can see from Georgetown. Granted, there's not much there. But it sure has a great veiw and it's right over Key Bridge.

Tudor Place: A House for All Seasons

At Tudor Place now, Window on Washington showcases objects both familiar and "new" (very old, but new to Tudor Place and the public).

DC Taxis Seeing Red

If the city adopts a recommendation from a DC Taxicab commission committee, all taxis in the District of Columbiawill be red by 2018, reports Greater Greater Washington.

Black Movements Dance Theatre at GU Feb. 15 & 16

This Friday and Saturday, February 15 and 16 starting at 8:00 pm the Black Movements Dance Theatre will be performing at the Davis Performing Arts Center in the Gonda Theatre on the campus of Georgetown University.

Dying Maple Removed in Volta Park

By Alix PianinCurrent Staff Writer

Some Georgetown residents near Volta Park are expressing surprise at the recent loss of a maple tree that had stood at the park for more than half a century, but several community leaders say the tree was unhealthy and hazardous.

The Decanting of Wine

Have you ever ordered a bottle of wine in a restaurant and noted that the last glass tasted much better than the first? Or found that the wine was really starting to come together just when the dessert was being presented and your server was trying to steal away your glass?

On-Demand Uber Romance

This year, Uber is putting a modern twist on a Valentine's Day tradition ... by giving you a chance to send that special someone a dozen beautiful red roses, all at the push of a button.

Celebrate George with the Dames Feb. 20

On Wednesday, February 20th at 6 pm, join the National Society of The Colonial Dames of America in D.C. as they host a cocktail hour, lecture and book signing to celebrate our first President's birthday at The Dumbarton House.

An Ultra Violet Valentine's Day!

Magic happens with a bouquet from Ultra Violet! Fabio and his team create exquisite floral arrangements for Valentine's Day .. and every day. Order today.

A Ruff Night and Day at the Fairmont

Imagine a night away with your TWO favorite sweethearts ... at the Fairmont Washington D.C., Georgetown. This is your lucky month!

Elegant Apartment at The Residences at The Ritz-Carlton on Market

Celebrating its first anniversary, Beasley Real Estate marked the occasion with the launch of a new listing: a posh apartment at the Residences at the Ritz-Carlton Georgetown, replete with two parking spaces

Palermo Art Scene

As I mentioned in my last article, I was very exited about the opening of the first Palermo International Biennial. Well, I visited it and I can't hide my disappointment.

Georgetown in Harmony with City on Zoning

Zoning, i.e., the rules that govern the size, height and use of buildings, is a highly complex, legalistic governmental function that most people find boring. However, it is crucial in shaping the District's future as the population, commercial and institutional activites change.

The American Grand Cru Society Hosts 'From Obscurity to Excellence' Wine Documentary

Jackie's Hat

I had the good fortune to visit the “Andy Warhol: 15 Minutes Eternal” exhibition at the Hong Kong Museum of Art last month, and saw his paintings of Jackie Kennedy for the first time. They are extraordinary.

My Favorite Chinese Restaurant

Celebrating the Year of the Snake is a great time to sample the best of this city's Chinese cuisine. My favorite for 20 years has been Far East Restaurant in Rockville, Maryland.
GTC Hosts Learning Lunch on Design Legacy of Jacobsen Architecture

The State of the District is Great!

On Tuesday evening, February 5 the Mayor delivered his State of the District Speech to a packed house at the historic restored synagogue on 6th and Eye Street. It was a location fitting a speech about a restored city.

Agency Again Vows Rehab of Decrepit Alley Off R Street

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

Residents living along a deteriorating alley in eastern Georgetown are getting fresh promises that the city will address the pitted road surface and the stormwater runoff behind their homes.

Turn Up The Heat Gala's 'Winter Harvest Slaw' Recipe

Clyde's Valentine's Day Date Night Contest

There's Always Next Season

I am lucky to live part time in Georgetown, and part time in the French Quarter neighborhood of New Orleans. Over the past few years, I have grown to love my new home (the latter) as much as my true home (the former), although for completely different reasons.

Tish Alsop Home in Woodley Park On Market

The former home of Patricia “Tish” Alsop in Woodley Park is on the market for $1,690,000, and what a house it is! If the walls could tell amazing stories, pages of history would be retold.
CAG's Georgetown Art Show at House of Sweden

In the Pink With Farruggio

International business guru Daniel H. Pink has singled out il Canale on 31st Street, in Georgetown, for praise in his brand new book “To Sell Is Human,” which is available at Barnes & Noble and Amazon.
